ValueDomain.preferredName: Dispensed Amount Drug Accountability Record Categorization Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of a product that has been dispensed._A classification of the drug accountability._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the type of treatmen
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the type of treatment dispensed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology (e.g., TOBACCO, ALCOHOL, CAFFEINE). Sponsors may require different types of substance use data (e.g., illicit drug use, cigarettes, etc.); the value for category may be pre-printed on the CRF. If a more detailed type of substance appears on the CRF (e.g., CIGARETTES, CIGARS, rather than TOBACCO), SUCAT is TOBACCO and SUTRT is CIGARETTES. If the sponsor does not specify a type of tobacco on the CRF, SUTRT is TOBACCO. If SUCAT is not collected (e.g. it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SUCAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the Substance Used category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
